any of several wild plants with heart-shaped leaves, small flowers and divided stems: We do have native knotweeds in this country. Cover the roots of knotweed with black plastic.
More examplesFewer examplesSome weeds grow in situations of compacted soil, such as knotweed.Soil within 20 to 30 feet of a knotweed plant can contain rhizomes, which can grow into new plants.Knotweeds can be removed by cutting them every four to six weeks during their growing season.
